designScenario.name: Landing Gear Steering System
designScenario.description: A critical system providing directional control of the aircraft's nose gear during ground operations, including taxi, takeoff, and landing. It integrates electromechanical actuation, hydraulic power (if applicable), and closed-loop control to ensure precise steering response, redundancy, and compliance with aviation safety standards. Designed to operate under extreme environmental conditions and mechanical stresses while maintaining fail-safe behavior.

details.description: The system must convert pilot/autopilot steering commands into accurate nose gear angular displacement (±60° minimum) via electrical/hydraulic signals.
Provide dual redundant control signal paths to ensure operational continuity during single-channel failures.
Achieve full deflection from center to maximum steering angle (60°) in ≤ 0.4 seconds under 500 Nm load.
Incorporate mechanical centering springs and hydraulic pressure relief valves to return nose gear to neutral position during power loss.
Implement torque-limiting couplings to prevent structural overloads during ground collisions.
Operate reliably in temperatures from -55°C to +85°C with 95% relative humidity and resistance to de-icing fluids.
Meet DO-160G standards for vibration, shock, and electromagnetic interference.

systemComponents.name: Steering Control Unit (SCU)
systemComponents.description: Primary electronic controller processing pilot inputs, autopilot commands, and feedback signals to generate actuator control signals.

subComponents.name: Command Processor
subComponents.description: FPGA-based module executing steering algorithms and redundancy management.

subComponents.name: Signal Conditioning Unit
subComponents.description: Isolates and amplifies control signals to mitigate EMI effects.

systemComponents.name: Electro-Hydraulic Servo Actuator
systemComponents.description: Converts electrical commands from SCU into hydraulic pressure to drive steering mechanism.

subComponents.name: Solenoid Valves
subComponents.description: Direct hydraulic fluid flow based on SCU commands.

subComponents.name: Torque Motor
subComponents.description: Generates proportional force to position servo valve spools.

systemComponents.name: Steering Feedback Sensor
systemComponents.description: LVDT/RVDT-based sensor measuring actual nose gear position for closed-loop control.

subComponents.name: Signal Transmitter
subComponents.description: Converts angular displacement into analog/digital signals.

systemComponents.name: Hydraulic Power Pack
systemComponents.description: Provides regulated hydraulic pressure (3000 psi) to servo actuators.

subComponents.name: Priority Valve
subComponents.description: Ensures steering system receives priority flow during low-pressure conditions.

relationships.description: SCU transmits validated steering commands to the actuator's torque motor via ARINC 429 data buses.
Actuator requires continuous hydraulic pressure from the power pack to generate steering torque.
Feedback sensor provides real-time nose gear position data to SCU for closed-loop control.
Priority valve is an integral subcomponent ensuring hydraulic supply prioritization.

attributes.name: maxSteeringAngle
attributes.description: Maximum achievable nose gear deflection angle from neutral position.

attributes.name: systemResponseTime
attributes.description: Time delay between command input and 90% of target steering angle achievement.

attributes.name: hydraulicPressure
attributes.description: Operating pressure range for optimal actuator performance.

attributes.name: redundancyLevel
attributes.description: Architecture providing two independent hydraulic channels and two signal paths.

attributes.name: MTBF
attributes.description: Mean Time Between Failures under specified operating conditions.
